title: Test for "Flat" format. But also, Champion Update running discussion because why not?
body:
Hi. I wanted to try out the new function that should be listed below this box that says "show as flat" and see how the system works. I wanted to see if a conversation could be had using either or both of the views.

While we're here! we'll have a general ChampUp pow-wow. All casual, this is mainly just to test, but if you have any questions/ideas/feedback we can also jam on those. I'll be on here for a little bit then head to bed. I'll check the thread in the morning also.

**EDIT: **Going to head to bed for the night. Keep the discussion going. I'll check in the morning. Also, please take any notes about how your experience is inside the thread by using the flat and nested views. I'd like to take that feedback to the team to see if any ideas that users have opinions about can be implemented or improved. Thanks!

replies.body: Honestly I've always had an issue with {{champion:80}} . His stock character model just looks too cartoony in general. Yes League is fairly cartoony regardless, but... His is just eh. Maybe if he had a visual update somehow
He's sorta just a dude from 300 at this point. I'd really like to find a way to tie him more thematically into Targon. That'll take some exploration though.

Will Pantheon get the same love and affection you have for Leona & Diana?

Talking about VU if its not clear...

But I can understand if not. Those champs were your babies. You were part of their development. Plus they're females and Pantheon's not. But I was just wondering because he is from Mt. Targon and you're a big advocate of that. Plus he's an armored champ with prime potential for you to go HAM on.

Do you think a traditional skin would be a good idea for him? I think so for the fact that you can go balls deep and get real creative and original with him. You can really explore what a true Rakkor would look like, actually an elite one at that. You can make him look sooo epic without being held back by the 300/Spartan/Greek trope that some fans are attached to because he'll have a traditional skin. Just think about it like this... lets say he was never released until 2014, with what you guys have at your disposal now and no previous trope to hold you back, imagine how he'd look today. 

I'm actually not a fan of the old trope because I feel he can be so much more and i don't like exposed toes on an armored champion. But I do understand and respect that there are fans that do and still like that. With a traditional skin, I feel everybody can be satisfied. Its a win win, people won't get upset and will keep the old Panth they're attached to, while also getting an original armored badass , and IronStylus can have a lot of fun exploring and expressing a true Rakkor warrior.

The dude is quite literally a design right out of traditional Spartan mythos. So yeah, I think at some point we'll need a VU that takes his thematics and solidifies them. However, I'm not sure where that would be right now. A VU or thematic cohesion pass on Pantheon might need some more deep diving on Targon itself. Should he fit into the Leona/Diana storyline? I think so. I think it's an interesting opportunity to make him a pivotal character, not just some warrior dude with nothing terribly exceptional about him. However, I'm not sure what he represents in that story space of Targon nor what would really set him apart that would immediately say "oh snap, this guy is different and interesting."

Story aside, I think it might be interesting to do some foundation building on what the Rakkor are, and what they look like. We might need to do some groundwork to flesh out the society of the mountain, or what's on the mountain, to then extrapolate Pantheon's appearance from. There's a lot of different ways to approach him, right now I'm not sure which direction is a good one. Certainly open to suggestions.

I know that eventually he'll get a pass, my hope is that we can build further on the Moon/Sun story thing and give him a unique space visually and thematically,

I think some classical thematics should still be there, spartan inspired but not necessarily ripped right out from it.

I mean Kratos is obviously inspired by myth, but he looks a thing all on his own too.

Let me ask about a champion who VERY MUCH needs a VU but seems to be rarely spoken of:

{{champion:36}} 

His run is more of a waddle, his animations are non-existant (Like he doesn't even really do anything. All of his spells are just sound-bits), his body and look is iconic but not really that well portrayed and to top it all off his tongue is blue in his splash but it's STILL PINK IN GAME.

So my question is what you guys have planned for the Madman of Zaun. He's a super iconic character and definitely a fan favorite. I just hope you guys have some cool, amazing work in store for him. Anything you can spill or talk about?

Welp, I think he's just a straight up fidelity update. I don't think he's slated for any time too soon, but at least I don't think there's a lot of challenge in just.. Mundo'ing up Mundo. Yeah, there's just a lot of technical stuff I'd love to do with him. Bring him up to the goofy brute that he should be.

I always disliked how Mundo is portrayed as an incredibely stupid hulk in the game but he is still a doctor performing complicated experiments on himself in the lore. I'd like to see this mixed a bit more where he still has moments of insight in between the effects of the drugs he uses on the fields of justice.

About the flat view: I found it a bit tricky to see who people were responding to in nested view and I can't up/downvote.
It is a bit odd, isn't it? Maybe all those experiments made him a giant goofball brute?
What would you do to make Zilean "cool" as a character because currently there doesn't seem to be anything attractive about him at all.

Yeah.. the "old guy" fantasy is a hard one to capture. I think there might have to be something in there that moves him more into the "cool mage" sorta area. It's fine being wise and older, but he's not quite up there with characters like Captain Picard, Professor X, Sauramon, Magneto, or other more aged gents of wisdom and badassery, Might have to dial him just a bit younger or just make him feel a bit more fit, not so much afro-santa guy..
O.o Since you pulled in the Star Trek reference, maybe give Zilean some Q influence? I'm sure there's something that can be pulled outa that.
Now that's a cool idea!

Why does Zilean have to be a "cool mage" or "badass"? Aren't there other traits that could be considered appropriate for the old time wizard, or traits that would make him attractive in a way that only Zilean could be?

While I don't like to talk too much on the Trundle changes, it's similar to how you guys said "alright, we know this guy has niche appeal because he's scrappy, sarcastic, and runty, but wouldn't he be more cool, wouldn't he be really 'badass', if we beefed him up a bunch, made him king, and had him shout a bunch of hammy one-liners?" Now, that isn't to say that this sort of character doesn't have any appeal, but you end up with something of a "personality net-negative" when you throw him in with other "dumb brute" archetypes like Mundo!

Part of having such a large and diverse roster of champions, is that you have one of the biggest opportunities to really allow for niche appeal in a lot of them. You have room to really look at any champion out of the 110+ you have right now and really think, "Alright, how can we make this character appealing in a way that only this character could truly hit all the right notes on?" This is something I've felt you (collectively) have really hit home on with champions like Braum, Jinx, Vel'Koz--hell, a lot of the new champions, to be honest--but not so much on reworks like Trundle or Nasus, where the solution seemed to be "make them bigger, meaner, and crank up the 'badass' to 11." Keep in mind that you're an ice cream parlor with over a hundred flavors, so never be afraid to do a bit of exploration and stay true to a flavor that might not be the most popular or least polarizing! Cotton candy, for example, might not be the most popular flavor, but keeping it in stock won't chase away the masses of vanilla fans and chocolate lovers! 

I don't think I'll speak on this much more in the future, but it would be great if you (collectively) would keep in mind that there's hundreds upon hundreds of ways to make a character appealing, and that the question instead should be, "What kind of appeal could this champion and this champion alone really hit out of the park?" I might not be the target audience for [Keeper of the Light](http://dota2.gamepedia.com/Keeper_of_the_Light_responses)-like doddering old dudes, but that doesn't mean that there isn't an audience for them!

I agree. Genericization is highly problematic, and as you point out seems utterly unnecessary given how many Champions there are to choose from.

I really disliked the Nasus rework from "inexorable immortal" to "angry snarling dog-man with big stick".

I still see him as inexorable immortal.

With a pick or ban rate of nearly 100% for multiple seasons in LCS and probably longer for us normies in ranked, Kassadin is one of the most prominent of champions. Why have we not seen a visual update for such an old model yet?  Kassadin's model is truly aged, moreso than many others (but not as much as some e.g. Pantheon). Indeed, things have slowed down a bit. I'm not 100% up on the skinny, as you said I don't work on the team really, but I think there's a general desire to make sure things are super cohesive when a new champion comes out. I think that can take additional bake time. Aside from that I'm not privy to the nitty gritty of production, but I think one of the reasons Relaunch has become a bit more consistent is to help out the churning of new content. In some cases are team is pretty much making a new champion. My feeling is that things will always sort of be a hybrid of champions, skins and now relaunches as being integral parts of content packages. 

I understand though. Champions are the biggest hype potential in terms of content, and can really have amazing promotional content, community discussion, and general excitement surround their build up and release. The champion release is still our biggest bang I feel. It feels like something huge is being added to the game, which it is. 

For me personally, I miss some of the old days of slightly faster cadence, but I trust that the guys over on the Champion Team know what's up and are fully aware of what they're goals and deliverables are, and how fast those things should be put out.
